post.description:
Create a new brand and automatically trigger knowledge workflow.

Creates a new brand with server-generated ID and immediately starts
a knowledge extraction workflow in the background.

Args:
    firebase_user: Authenticated Firebase user (injected by auth dependency)
    request: Brand creation request

409.description: Brand with this name already exists

get.description:
List all brands.

Returns a list of brands with pagination support.

schema.title: Response List Brands Api V2 Brands Get

put.description:
Update an existing brand.

Updates an existing brand. Returns 404 if the brand doesn't exist.
Only provided fields will be updated (partial update).

get.description:
Get brand information.

Returns the brand details and status.
Returns 404 if brand doesn't exist.

RMM-2 Compliant Pattern:
- Use GET /brands/{brand_id} for basic brand data
- Use GET /brands/{brand_id}?include=files to explicitly request file URLs
- Replaces non-compliant pattern: GET /brands/{brand_id}/with-files (hyphenated segment)

Query Parameters:
- include: Optional comma-separated list of additional data to include
          Supported values: 'files' (includes brand_guidelines_url, logo_url)
          Example: ?include=files

Note: File URLs (brand_guidelines_url, logo_url) are always included in the
response for backward compatibility. The include parameter is provided to
demonstrate RMM-2 best practices using query parameters instead of hyphenated
path segments.

parameters.name: include

schema.description: Comma-separated list of additional data to include (e.g., 'files')
schema.title: Include

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of additional data to include (e.g., 'files')

put.description:
Update selected brand colors (including custom colors).

Updates the brand colors with enhanced metadata including color names,
usage roles (primary/secondary/accent), and custom status.

get.description:
Get progress for a brand workflow (RMM-2 compliant).

Returns detailed progress information for the brand workflow.
Supports polling for real-time updates.

This endpoint replaces the deprecated /brands/{brand_id}/extraction/progress endpoint.
The workflowId parameter represents the type of workflow (e.g., 'extraction').

patch.description:
Update brand onboarding progress step.

Tracks onboarding workflow progress including current step, completed steps,
and optional metadata to keep the frontend aligned with backend state.

Update brand onboarding status (RMM-2 compliant).

Richardson Maturity Model Level 2 compliant endpoint using PATCH to update
the status resource of a brand. Validates that all required approvals have
been given and marks the brand onboarding process as completed.

This endpoint replaces the deprecated POST /brands/{brand_id}/complete endpoint.

post.description:
Upload brand files (guidelines PDF and logo) with LLM extraction.

Proper REST endpoint for uploading brand files to an existing brand.
Extracts structured brand information (colors, typography, photography)
from PDF brand guidelines using LLM processing.

201.description: Brand files uploaded and processed successfully

put.description:
Update brand files (guidelines PDF and logo).

Proper REST endpoint for updating brand files.
Replaces the non-RESTful /with-files endpoint.

post.description:
Generate a cohesive brand summary from current brand data.

**RMM L2 Decision**: POST /api/v2/brands/{brand_id}/summary
- Summary is a computed sub-resource of brand
- POST generates new summary from current brand data
- Not idempotent (each call generates fresh summary)

Ports V1 logic from ReviewForm.tsx getSummary() function:
- Generates 60-word brand summary via LLM (OpenAI GPT-4)
- Includes: mission, vision, values, tone/voice, persona, industry, vertical
- Excludes: brand colors, service lists, location
- Returns cohesive paragraph summarizing brand identity

Extract physical locations from text or brand knowledge.

Extracts structured physical location information (address, city, state, country)
from either provided text or from the brand's stored knowledge base.

RMM-2 Compliant Pattern:
- POST verb for action-oriented extraction operation
- Hierarchical resource path: /brands/{id}/extract/locations
- Uses path segment 'extract' as namespace for extraction sub-resources
- Returns 200 OK with extracted data (not 201 as no resource is created)

Business Context:
- Enables location-based marketing and targeting
- Extracts from brand website content, social media, or provided text
- Uses AI/LLM for intelligent location extraction
- Results are structured for easy querying and filtering

Request Body:
- text (optional): Text content to extract locations from
- If text not provided, extracts from brand's stored knowledge

Args:
    brand_id: The brand identifier
    request: LocationExtractionRequest with optional text
    extractor_service: Injected ExtractorService for extraction

Returns:
    LocationExtractionResponse with list of extracted locations

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if brand not found, 400 for invalid data, 500 on failure

schema.description: Optional text to extract locations from

post.description:
Start knowledge discovery workflow for a brand.

Creates a new workflow resource that orchestrates website crawling,
content extraction, and knowledge storage. This is an explicit trigger
following RMM Level 2 principles.

The workflow runs asynchronously. Poll the status endpoint to monitor progress.

Design Pattern (RMM L2):
- POST creates a workflow resource (not an RPC "scrape" action)
- Returns 202 Accepted (async processing)
- Provides workflow_id for status polling
- Idempotent: multiple POSTs return existing workflow if already running

409.description: Workflow already running for this brand

get.description:
Get the status of the knowledge collection workflow.

Returns the current status of the background workflow including
progress, current step, and any results. This endpoint is used
by the frontend to monitor the progress of the knowledge extraction
that was initiated internally during brand creation.

404.description: No workflow found for this brand

post.description:
Create knowledge resource from crawled pages (RMM-2 compliant).

Analyzes crawled content to extract and store brand knowledge including
personality traits, tone attributes, visual style, products, etc.
This endpoint follows RMM Level 2 principles by using POST to create
a knowledge resource rather than using a verb in the URL.

This is a workflow operation typically triggered by crawling completion.

Design Pattern (RMM L2):
- POST creates a knowledge resource (not an RPC "extract" action)
- Returns 201 Created with the knowledge resource
- Resource-oriented URL: /brands/{id}/knowledge

get.description:
Get extracted brand knowledge in V2 format with pagination.

Returns the extracted brand knowledge including personality traits,
tone attributes, color palette, products, and descriptions. This endpoint
provides the structured knowledge after workflow completion.

Supports pagination parameters for future compatibility when multiple
knowledge entries per brand are supported.

get.summary: Get Brand Knowledge Summary By Brand
get.description:
Get summary statistics for a brand's knowledge entries.

Returns summary statistics including total entries count,
last updated timestamp, and category breakdown for the specified brand.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET to /brands/{brand_id}/knowledge/summary retrieves summary resource
- HTTP verb (GET) indicates retrieval
- No verbs in URL path
- Resource-oriented URL structure

List brand knowledge entries with pagination.

Returns a paginated list of brand knowledge entries across all brands
or filtered by a specific brand ID. This endpoint is useful for
dashboard views and admin interfaces.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET to /knowledge collection retrieves resources
- Pagination via query parameters (page, page_size)
- No verbs in URL path

200.description: List of brand knowledge entries returned

get.description:
Get summary statistics for brand knowledge.

Returns aggregated statistics across all brands including
total brands, average traits, most common traits, and recently
updated entries.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET to /knowledge/summary retrieves aggregate resource
- No verbs in URL path
- HTTP verb (GET) indicates retrieval

post.description:
Extract and merge knowledge from multiple campaigns (RMM-2 compliant).

This endpoint implements controller orchestration pattern where the controller
coordinates multiple services (campaign_service and brand_knowledge_service)
to extract knowledge from campaign content and merge it into brand knowledge.

The controller:
1. Gets campaigns using campaign_service
2. Extracts content from each campaign
3. Merges knowledge using brand_knowledge_service
4. Returns combined knowledge

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- POST creates a knowledge resource (not an RPC "extract" action)
- Returns 201 Created with the knowledge resource
- Resource-oriented URL: /brands/{id}/knowledge/batches
- Controller handles orchestration, services handle business logic

Args:
    brand_id: The brand ID
    request: Request containing campaign IDs to extract knowledge from
    campaign_service: Injected campaign service for retrieving campaigns
    brand_knowledge_service: Injected knowledge service for extraction

Returns:
    Combined brand knowledge extracted from all campaigns

Raises:
    HTTPException: If extraction fails or campaigns not found

201.description: Knowledge extracted and merged from campaigns

post.description:
Create a new campaign and auto-trigger content generation workflow.

Creates a new campaign with server-generated ID. The campaign name should be unique.
User ID is extracted from the authenticated user's JWT token for security.

After successful campaign creation, automatically triggers the content generation
workflow. If workflow fails to start, the campaign is rolled back (deleted) and
an error is returned to the user.

Args:
    firebase_user: Authenticated Firebase user (injected by auth dependency)
    request: Campaign creation request (user_id extracted from JWT, not body)
    brand_repository: Repository for brand data access
    campaign_service: Service for campaign CRUD operations
    workflow_service: Service for triggering GCP Workflows
    api_config: API configuration with base URL

Returns:
    CampaignResponse: The created campaign with workflow triggered successfully

Raises:
    HTTPException: 401 if authentication fails, 400 for invalid data,
                 500 if workflow fails to start (campaign is rolled back)

401.description: Unauthorized - invalid or missing authentication token

409.description: Campaign with this name already exists

get.description:
List all campaigns for the authenticated user.

Args:
    firebase_user: Authenticated Firebase user (injected by auth dependency)

Returns:
    List of campaigns for the authenticated user

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: Deprecated: campaigns now scoped to authenticated user
schema.title: User Id

put.description:
Update an existing campaign (full update).

Updates an existing campaign. Returns 404 if the campaign doesn't exist.
Only provided fields will be updated (partial update).

patch.description:
Partially update a campaign (e.g., publish).

This is the RMM Level 2 compliant endpoint for partial campaign updates.
Instead of POST /campaigns/{id}/publish, use PATCH with status update.

Example: To publish a campaign, send PATCH with {"status": "published"}

get.description:
Get campaign information.

Returns the campaign details and status.
Returns 404 if campaign doesn't exist.

delete.description:
Delete a campaign.

Deletes the specified campaign. Returns 204 on successful deletion.
Returns 404 if campaign doesn't exist.

get.description:
Get campaign statistics.

Returns detailed statistics for a specific campaign including engagement metrics,
platform breakdown, content performance, and campaign progress.

post.description:
Create a campaign publication (RMM L2: publication is a resource).

Direct port from V1 POST /api/v1/campaign/publish endpoint.

RMM L2 Rationale:
- Publications are resources representing published campaign instances
- Creating publication is resource creation (not RPC-style /publish)
- Publications track platform, schedule, and status

This endpoint:
- Validates campaign exists and has approved content
- Schedules posts via Cloud Scheduler (TODO)
- Returns publication summary with scheduling results

Generate campaign specifications using LLM analysis.

Direct port from V1 /api/v1/llm/openai endpoint used by CampaignDetails.tsx.

Analyzes campaign data (objective, audience, product features) and generates
structured specifications including:
- key_features: Product benefits and competitive features
- audience: Target audience description with demographics
- purpose: Campaign goal and focus description

RMM L2 Design: Specifications are a computed sub-resource of campaign.
POST generates new specs from current campaign data using LLM analysis.

Generate audience emotion and interest suggestions for campaign.

Direct port from V1 AudienceForm.tsx audience suggestion logic.

RMM L2 Rationale:
- Suggestions are computed sub-resource under campaign audience
- POST generates new suggestions based on campaign context
- Returns emotional triggers and interest categories
- Uses OpenAI for intelligent audience analysis

This endpoint:
- Fetches campaign and brand data
- Constructs LLM prompt for audience analysis
- Generates emotion and interest arrays using GPT-4
- Returns exactly 3 items in each array

Bulk approve campaign content for specified weeks.

Direct port from V1 POST /api/v1/approve-all endpoint.
Used by ExportComponent.tsx line 302 for bulk content approval.

RMM L2 Rationale:
- Approvals are resources being created in bulk
- POST creates multiple approval resources at once
- Returns detailed results for each approval operation

This endpoint:
- Validates campaign exists and has content
- Iterates through specified weeks (e.g., ["week_1", "week_2"])
- Approves all days (1-7) within each week
- Returns counts of approved/failed/skipped approvals
- Supports selective week approval for flexible workflows

get.description:
Get approval status for a campaign.

Direct port from V1 /api/v1/check-approved endpoint used by TabItems.tsx.

Returns whether all campaign content is approved for export, along with
approval counts. This endpoint is used to enable/disable the export button
in the UI.

RMM L2 Rationale:
- approval-status is a computed sub-resource of campaign
- GET retrieves the current approval state (not a state change)
- Returns structured data: {approved, approvedCount, totalCount}

Returns:
    - approved: true if all content is approved, false otherwise
    - approved_count: number of approved posts
    - total_count: total number of posts in campaign

Get detailed export approval status for a campaign.

Direct port from V1 /api/v1/check-approved endpoint used by TabItems.tsx:34.

Returns detailed approval status for the export workflow including:
- Whether all content is approved
- Count of approved posts
- Total count of posts
- List of unapproved content IDs (for UI to show what needs approval)

RMM L2 Rationale:
- export/approval-status is a computed sub-resource of campaign
- GET retrieves the current export-ready state (not a state change)
- Returns structured data with additional unapproved_content_ids field
- Separates general approval-status from export-specific approval-status

Used by export functionality to:
- Enable/disable export button
- Show which content items need approval before export
- Provide detailed feedback to user

Returns:
    - approved: true if all content is approved, false otherwise
    - approved_content: number of approved posts
    - total_content: total number of posts in campaign
    - unapproved_content_ids: list of content IDs that are not approved

500.description: Failed to get export approval status

get.description:
Get campaign PDF export data (RMM L2: export is a sub-resource).

Direct port from V1 GET /api/v1/getPdfData?campaign_id={id} endpoint.
Used by frontend src/shared/utils/exportUtils.ts:51 for PDF generation.

RMM L2 Rationale:
- Export data is a computed sub-resource of campaign
- GET returns pre-formatted data for PDF generation
- Includes campaign metadata, brand profile, and content

This endpoint:
- Returns all data needed for PDF generation
- Includes campaign, brand, and content information
- Optimized for frontend PDF rendering
- Performance target: <2s response time

Frontend usage: fetchAndCreatePDF() calls this to get:
- client_request (campaign variables and metadata)
- brand_profile (brand identity and styling)
- campaign_brief (campaign details and content)

post.description:
Create a new version of a caption (RMM-2 compliant regeneration).

This is the REST-compliant version of caption regeneration.
Instead of POST /regenerate (verb), we POST /versions (noun) to create a resource.

Business Context:
- Creates a new caption version with user feedback and adjustments
- Maintains caption versioning history for auditing
- Supports iterative refinement of AI-generated captions

RMM-2 Compliance:
- Uses resource noun 'versions' instead of verb 'regenerate'
- Creates a new version resource through POST method
- Returns 201 Created status code
- Proper camelCase parameter naming

Args:
    content_id: Parent content identifier
    caption_id: Caption identifier to create new version from
    request: Regeneration parameters (feedback, adjustments, tone)

Returns:
    CaptionResponse with the newly generated caption version

Raises:
    404 Not Found: If content or caption doesn't exist
    500 Internal Server Error: If caption generation fails

Validate captions against brand guidelines (RMM-2 compliant).

This endpoint validates multiple captions against platform-specific requirements
and brand guidelines, returning detailed validation results and suggestions.

RMM-2 Compliance: Uses resource noun 'validations' instead of verb 'validate'.
Creates a validation resource through POST method.

Approve or unapprove content for a specific day.

This endpoint allows users to approve/reject content for a specific day.
Updates approval status in database and manages approval counters.
Direct port from V1 tag v0.2.46.

Args:
    firebase_user: Authenticated Firebase user (injected by auth dependency)
    content_id: ID of the content to approve
    request: Approval request with week, day, and post data
    content_approval_service: Injected service

Returns:
    Updated day data with approval status

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if content not found, 400 if request invalid

Update content fields (e.g., approval status).

This is the RMM Level 2 compliant endpoint for content updates including approval.
Instead of POST /content/{id}/approve, we use PATCH /content/{id} with approved=true.

get.description:
Get content for a campaign.

This is the RMM Level 2 compliant endpoint for retrieving campaign content.

post.description:
Create content for a campaign.

This is the RMM Level 2 compliant endpoint for creating content for a campaign.
Supports two modes:
1. Assembly mode: When 'posts' array is provided, assembles posts into content calendar
2. Generation mode: When no 'posts' array, generates content using AI

This endpoint is called by the campaign-generator workflow to assemble posts
into a content calendar structure.

Args:
    campaign_id: Campaign ID
    request: Content creation data (may include 'posts' array for assembly)

Returns:
    Created content record

Raises:

post.description:
Create new content or regenerate existing content.

This is the RMM Level 2 compliant endpoint for content creation/regeneration.
Instead of POST /content/{id}/regenerate, we POST to /content to create a new version.

The client can include metadata indicating this is a regeneration of existing content.

Security: user_id is extracted from the JWT token and cannot be manipulated by the client.

Create a new version of content (RMM L2 compliant regeneration).

This is the REST-compliant version of content regeneration.
Instead of POST /regenerate (verb), we POST /versions (noun) to create a resource.

Direct port from V1 (tag v0.2.46) with proper REST design:
- Creates a new version as a resource
- Maintains parent-child lineage
- Enforces plan limits: FREE=3, PRO=10 versions per content

Args:
    content_id: Content identifier (from URL path)
    request: Version creation request with parent ID and optional prompt

Returns:
    ContentVersionResponse with new version details and quota info

Raises:
    400 Bad Request: If content not found or generation limit exceeded
    500 Internal Server Error: If version creation fails

Start a content generation workflow for a campaign.

This endpoint triggers the Google Cloud Workflow for campaign content generation.
The workflow runs asynchronously, orchestrating:
1. Campaign plan generation (scene mix)
2. Text content generation using LLM
3. Image generation using AI

The workflow executes in the background. Poll the workflow status endpoint
to monitor progress.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- POST creates a workflow resource (not an RPC "generate" action)
- Returns 202 Accepted (async processing)
- Provides workflow_id for status polling

get.description:
Get the status of a content generation workflow.

This endpoint retrieves the current status of a workflow execution,
including progress, current step, and completion status.

Use this endpoint to poll for workflow completion after starting

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- GET retrieves workflow resource by ID
- Resource-oriented URL structure
- Returns workflow state representation

Args:
    campaign_id: Campaign ID the workflow belongs to
    workflow_id: Workflow execution ID (from start_campaign_content_workflow)
    workflow_service: Injected workflow service

Returns:
    CampaignWorkflowResponse with current workflow status

Raises:
    HTTPException: 404 if workflow not found, 500 on service errors

Crawl a single page for workflow-driven crawling.

This endpoint is designed to be called by Google Cloud Workflows
for each individual page. The workflow handles iteration and
orchestrates the overall crawling process.

post.description:
Render a JavaScript-heavy page with Playwright and extract content.

This endpoint uses Playwright to render modern SPAs (React, Vue, Angular)
that require JavaScript execution. It's slower than traditional crawling
but enables access to dynamically-generated content.

Use this endpoint when:
- Static HTML crawling fails or returns incomplete content
- The website uses client-side rendering
- Content is loaded via JavaScript after page load

The endpoint will:
1. Launch a headless browser
2. Navigate to the URL and wait for network idle
3. Optionally wait for a specific selector
4. Extract the rendered HTML and text content
5. Discover links on the page
6. Store the page data

Args:
    brand_id: Brand ID for the crawl
    request: Render request with URL, optional selector, and timeout

Returns:
    CrawlPageWorkflowResponse with extracted content and discovered URLs

Initialize a new crawl queue for a brand (RMM-2 compliant).

This is the RMM-2 compliant endpoint that uses POST to the queue resource
to initialize a new crawl session. It cleans up any previous queue entries
and sets up a fresh crawl with the starting URL.

RMM-2 Compliance:
- Uses POST method to create queue resource
- Resource-oriented URL with single-word segment (queue vs crawl-queue)
- No verb in URL (initialize action is implied by POST method)

get.description:
List crawl queue entries for a brand with optional filtering.

schema.title: Response List Queue Entries Api V2 Brands  Brand Id  Queue Get

get.description:
Get the next URL to crawl from the queue (RMM-2 compliant).

This is the RMM-2 compliant endpoint that uses the single-word resource
'queue' instead of the hyphenated 'crawl-queue'.

RMM-2 Compliance:
- Uses GET method for read operation

get.description:

Returns system-level AI prompts used for content generation.
Filtering by category helps frontend fetch only relevant prompts.

Performance:
- Response time: <10ms (in-memory cache)
- Cache-Control header set for client-side caching
- No database calls required

RMM Level 2:
- HTTP GET for resource retrieval
- Query parameter for filtering (not in URL path)
- Returns 200 OK with list of prompts

Returns:

    {
      "prompts": [

          "id": "brand_summary_v1",
          "category": "brand",
          "template": "Create a summary for {brand_name}...",
          "variables": ["brand_name"],
          "version": "1.0.0",
          "description": "Brand summary generation"
        }
      ],
      "total": 1
    }

Creates a new AI prompt template that can be used for content generation.
The prompt ID must be unique across all prompts.

- HTTP POST for resource creation

      "category": "content",
      "template": "Generate variations...",
      "variables": ["brand_name"],
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "description": "Content variation generator"

Refresh an expiring or expired JWT token.

This endpoint allows native auth users to refresh their JWT tokens
without requiring re-authentication. The endpoint accepts expired tokens
(within a reasonable grace period) and issues a new token with fresh
expiration.

Security considerations:
- Validates token signature and structure
- Checks if token is blacklisted (logged out)
- Preserves original token claims in new token
- Does not extend refresh capability indefinitely

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- POST to /auth/refresh refreshes authentication token
- HTTP verb (POST) indicates action
- Returns new token with fresh expiration

Args:
    credentials: HTTP Bearer token credentials from request header
    auth_service: Injected authentication service
    token_blacklist_service: Injected token blacklist service

Returns:
    TokenRefreshResponse with new access token and expiration time

Raises:
    HTTPException 401: If token is invalid, malformed, or blacklisted
    HTTPException 500: If token refresh fails due to server error

get.description:
Get current authenticated user profile.

Retrieves the profile of the currently authenticated user based on
their authentication token. Supports both Firebase Auth and native
email/password authentication.

For native auth users:
- Token contains uid = database user ID
- Look up user by ID directly

For Firebase auth users:
- Token contains uid = Firebase UID
- Look up user by Firebase UID, or create if first login (lazy sync)

This endpoint implements lazy user creation for Firebase Auth users.
If a user authenticates via Firebase but doesn't have a database record,
one is created automatically using data from the Firebase token.

The response includes a has_brand field indicating whether the user
has any associated brands in the system.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- Resource-based URL: /users/me
- HTTP method (GET) indicates read action
- No verbs in URL path
- Uses /me convention for current authenticated user

Args:
    firebase_user: Decoded token claims (injected by auth dependency)
    user_service: Injected user service

Returns:
    UserResponse with user profile data including has_brand field

Raises:
    HTTPException 401: If authentication token is missing or invalid
    HTTPException 500: If database or server error occurs

post.description:
Resend email verification email to current user.

Resends the email verification email with a new verification token
to the currently authenticated user. Only works for native auth users
who have not yet verified their email.

RMM Level 2 Compliance:
- Resource-based URL: /users/me/verifications
- HTTP method (POST) indicates create action
- No verbs in URL path
- Uses /me convention for current authenticated user

Args:
    firebase_user: Decoded token claims (injected by auth dependency)
    user_service: Injected user service

Returns:
    ResendVerificationResponse with success status and message

Raises:
    HTTPException 400: If email already verified or user not eligible
    HTTPException 401: If authentication token is missing or invalid
    HTTPException 500: If email send fails or server error occurs
